description: From Middle French modeste, from Latin modestus.

adjectives.description: modest (comparative more modest or modester, superlative most modest or modestest)

entries.meaning: Not bragging or boasting about oneself or one's achievements; unpretentious, humble.

examples: He earns a modest amount of money.
Her latest novel was a modest success.

entries.meaning: Pure and delicate from a sense of propriety.
(especially of behaviour or clothing) Intending to avoid the encouraging of sexual attraction in others.
